name: Juan Karlos Labajo
description:
'''Juan Karlos Labajo''' ({{IPA|tl|hwan ˈkaɾlos lɐˈbaho|lang}}; born February 5, 2001) is a Filipino singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. Labajo rose to fame at age 13 when he finished third in the [[The Voice Kids (Philippine season 1)|first season]] (2014) of [[The Voice Kids (Philippine TV series)|''The Voice Kids'']]. He is the frontman and primary songwriter of his namesake band [[Juan Karlos]]. He has since released two studio albums as a solo artist and three studio albums with his band.

As an actor, he had supporting roles in the [[ABS-CBN]] television series ''[[Hawak Kamay (TV series)|Hawak-Kamay]]'' (2014), ''[[Pangako Sa 'Yo (2015 TV series)|Pangako Sa 'Yo]]'' (2015–16), ''[[A Love to Last]]'' (2017), and ''[[Senior High (TV series)|Senior High]]'' (2023–24). He was also a celebrity housemate in the reality show ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Lucky 7]]'' (2016). In film, Labajo was nominated for the [[Gawad Urian Award]] for Best Supporting Actor for his role in ''Blue Room'' (2022). He also portrayed Senator [[Ninoy Aquino]] in the musical biopic ''[[Ako si Ninoy]]'' (2023).
